name: robin
readme_summary: Robin is an AI-powered tool designed for dark web Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) investigations. It utilizes Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance search queries, filter results from dark web search engines, and generate concise investigation summaries, making dark web data more accessible for analysis.
primary_use_case: Conducting AI-assisted investigations and intelligence gathering on the dark web.
cover_image_prompt: A digital detective, wearing a hooded cloak made of binary code, stands at a crossroads in a dimly lit, abstract digital landscape representing the dark web. One path is chaotic and tangled, filled with fragmented data and obscured symbols. The detective holds a glowing magnifying glass that projects a refined, organized stream of information (represented by clean lines and clear icons) onto a holographic screen. Subtle UI elements and data streams flow from the magnifying glass to the screen, illustrating the AI's filtering and summarization process. The repository name 'Robin' is subtly integrated into the detective's cloak. The scene uses a dark, mysterious color palette with contrasting bright, analytical light from the magnifying glass and screen. Style: 3D isometric illustration with a focus on conceptual clarity and a hint of mystery.

name: LiveAvatar
description: Implementation of "Live Avatar: Streaming Real-time Audio-Driven Avatar Generation with Infinite Length"
readme_summary: Live Avatar is a framework for generating real-time, streaming, and infinitely long avatar videos driven by audio input. It utilizes a large diffusion model and block-wise autoregressive processing to achieve high frame rates and support extended video generation.
key_features: Real-time streaming interaction with high FPS (45 FPS)
Generalization across diverse characters and scenarios
FP8 quantization for reduced GPU memory usage (v1.1)
primary_use_case: Real-time, interactive, and infinitely long audio-driven avatar video generation for applications like virtual assistants, virtual influencers, and interactive storytelling.
cover_image_prompt: A vibrant, stylized scene depicting a sound wave transforming into a dynamic, expressive avatar in real-time. Imagine a glowing, ethereal sound wave flowing from a microphone towards a digital sculptor's hands. As the sound wave touches the hands, it rapidly coalesces into a fully formed, animated avatar that mirrors the emotion and cadence of the unseen speaker. Subtle UI elements showing audio input levels and avatar generation progress are visible in the background. The overall mood is futuristic and creative, with a clean, illustrative style. The repository name 'Live Avatar' is subtly integrated into a digital display. 3D isometric illustration style with bright, engaging colors and clear visual flow.

name: liam
description: Automatically generates beautiful and easy-to-read ER diagrams from your database.
readme_summary: Liam ERD is an open-source tool that automatically generates beautiful, interactive Entity Relationship (ER) diagrams from your database schemas. It simplifies the visualization of complex database structures with a user-friendly interface, seamless reverse engineering, and high performance for projects of all sizes.
key_features: Simple reverse engineering from existing databases
High performance for large schemas (100+ tables)
primary_use_case: Visualizing database schemas by automatically generating interactive ER diagrams.
cover_image_prompt: A master cartographer in a dimly lit, ancient library, using a magical quill to draw an intricate, glowing map. The map is not of land, but of interconnected abstract shapes and lines representing database tables and relationships. The quill's ink flows from a digital tablet displaying code snippets, transforming raw data into a clear, beautiful, and interactive schema map. Subtle digital particles emanate from the quill, highlighting the transformation. The overall mood is one of discovery and clarity, with a focus on the 'Liam ERD' name subtly etched onto the cartographer's desk. Style: 3D isometric illustration with a focus on glowing elements and clear, readable lines.

name: hyprshot-rs
description: A utility to easily take screenshots in Hyprland using your mouse.
readme_summary: Hyprshot-rs is a Rust utility for capturing screenshots in Wayland environments, specifically Hyprland and Sway. It offers flexible capture modes including full monitor, active monitor, selected region, and selected window, with options to save to disk or copy to the clipboard. The tool features a TOML configuration system and integrates seamlessly with Hyprland for automatic keybinding generation and setup.
key_features: Screenshot Capture (full monitor, active monitor, selected region, selected window, active window)
Save to specified folder and copy to clipboard
primary_use_case: Taking screenshots in Hyprland and Sway on Wayland with flexible capture options and easy integration.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, minimalist illustration of a digital magnifying glass hovering over a computer screen displaying the Hyprland desktop environment. The magnifying glass is actively 'zooming in' on a specific window or area, with a subtle glowing outline indicating the selection. From the magnifying glass, a small, perfectly formed PNG image icon is emerging, representing the captured screenshot. In the background, a small clipboard icon is visible, with a faint digital glow emanating from it, symbolizing the copy-to-clipboard functionality. The overall scene should be clean, modern, and convey precision and ease of use, with the repository name 'hyprshot-rs' subtly integrated into the UI elements or as a small watermark. The style should be 3D isometric illustration with a vibrant, tech-focused color palette.

name: speedtest-tracker
description: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted application that monitors the performance and uptime of your internet connection.
readme_summary: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted PHP application that automates internet speed tests and monitors connection performance over time. It captures detailed metrics, stores historical data, and provides notifications for performance drops.
key_features: Detailed Metrics (download/upload speeds, ping, packet loss)
primary_use_case: Monitoring and tracking internet connection performance and uptime through automated speed tests.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent lighthouse keeper on a cliffside, meticulously adjusting a complex lighthouse beam. The beam, instead of light, is a stream of data representing internet speed test results (download, upload, ping). The lighthouse itself is subtly branded with 'Speedtest Tracker'. Below, the ocean shows calm and stormy waves, symbolizing stable and unstable internet connections. Small, glowing digital readouts and subtle network icons float around the keeper, indicating the technical nature of the task. The scene is set at dusk with a dramatic, clear sky, emphasizing vigilance and consistent monitoring. Rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a clean, modern aesthetic and a color palette of blues, grays, and warm light from the lighthouse.
